alert.note: Alert for Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 12:48PM EDT until May 10 at 1:36AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maryland...Virginia... Potomac River at Edwards Ferry affecting Loudoun and Montgomery Counties. For the Potomac River...including Edwards Ferry...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Potomac River at Edwards Ferry. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Floodwaters begin to enter the store at Whites Ferry. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:31 PM EDT Monday the stage was 16.9 feet, or 2.2 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:16 AM EDT Monday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 9.1 feet by Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 03/02/2021. - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information. && River Name Fld Observed Mon Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 8PM 2AM 8AM Stg Time Date Potomac River Edwards Ferry 15.0 17.3 Mon 10 am 14.9 13.7 12.9 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around, and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1245 AM EDT.
